DeKalb Library Director Dee Coover updates City Council members on the status of the librarys  fiscal year Monday at the council meeting in the DeKalb Municipal Building  S PERIOD Fourth St PERIOD Coover spoke about DeKalbs Big Read Month in October and she told council members the groundbreaking ceremony for the DeKalb Library expansion was a success PERIOD

By  Jackie NevarezSeptember  

Mayor John Rey has proclaimed October Big Read Month as part of a library project that has earned a  grant PERIOD

The DeKalb Public Library received the grant in May from the National Endowment of the Arts PERIOD Rey named October Big Read Month at a City Council meeting Monday night PERIOD

Big Read Month

The annual grant is awarded nationally to  recipients with the DeKalb Public Library  Oak St. being one of three facilities that has received the grant for eight consecutive years PERIOD

Big Read Month is a series of events where the librarys goal is to give away copies of its selected book PERIOD A Wizard of Earthsea by Ursula K PERIOD Le Guin a story of a boys time in wizard school was chosen as the Big Read Month selection PERIOD Free copies of Le Guins book may be picked up at the library PERIOD

Fantasy Festival the kickoff for Big Read Month is  a.m. p.m PERIOD Oct PERIOD  at DeKalb High School  W PERIOD Dresser Road PERIOD The festival will include games crafts and a costume contest PERIOD

Library Director Dee Coover said Jesse White secretary of state and state librarian signed a check to the library for . million the jump start to the expenditure campaign for the library in January PERIOD The . million grant was the most money the state has awarded a public library Coover said PERIOD The library will use the grant to fund its expansion from  to  square feet according to the librarys website PERIOD

The librarys patron count has increased  percent since  and there has been a  percent increase in programs and  patrons came into the library last month Coover said PERIOD

Libraries are becoming the cultural centers of communities all across the nation Coover said PERIOD

Policy language disagreement

Finance Director Cathy Haley made a presentation on Resolution  adopting certain financial management policies after a Finance Advisory Committee review of the policies over the past months PERIOD

Fifth Ward Alderman Ron Naylor questioned the use of should and shall in the policies PERIOD Naylor referenced a policy which states The City Manager should submit an annual budget to the City Council which is within the Citys ability to pay. shall would be more appropriate as well as throughout that document Naylor said PERIOD Shall is mandatory should is permissive. haley said the language was changed by the committee level PERIOD

Rey said he suggested Haley and the committee review the language of the policies PERIOD The resolution was rescinded and will appear at the next City Council meeting Oct PERIOD  PERIOD
